intro: Stenostomum scrobiculatum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed stenostomum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branching stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Stenostomum scrobiculatum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
